fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Competition, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: Higher education and research policies; inter-university co-operation and inter-cultural exchanges; facilitating knowledge transfer; promoting the role of comprehensive multi-disciplinary research universities and promoting the role of universities in service to society at different levels, especially their impact on local, regional and global development.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: Founded in 1985 and formally constituted by Charter in 1987, the Coimbra Group is an association of long-established European comprehensive, multidisciplinary universities of high international standard committed to creating special academic and cultural ties to promote, for the benefit of its members, internationalisation, academic collaboration, excellence in learning and research, and service to society. It is also the purpose of the Group to influence European education and research policies and to develop best practice through the mutual exchange of experience.
relevant_communication:
High-level policy seminars alternating between research and higher education; in November 2017 on higher education at Trinity College Dublin; in December 2018 a research policy seminar at the Venice International University. 
Coordination of activities to support refugees to integrate at member universities. 
Participation in projects to facilitate recognition of learning outcomes and degrees.
